body_html:
@apaszke

Quality of code is pretty good, nothing convoluted so indeed this is a small patch and of course while I'm not a huge fan of the JS/emscripten world, its evolving nicely so everything works just like another platform. I'm going to test it soon on iOS/nintendo switch/PS4 actually, but I suspect compiling should be easy on those platforms.

You are right, it's big ( 300mb in debug, the .a is a big less then 30mb ) and probably slow ( we just use it for inference so that should be ok ) but still it fits the task for us.
The size in release might be smaller, dead code elimination and so on should help.
Still if you are bound to a nodejs only environment it's a better option at least for me.

Anyway it's just a start. 😄

body:
@apaszke 

Quality of code is pretty good, nothing convoluted so indeed this is a small patch and of course while I'm not a huge fan of the JS/emscripten world, its evolving nicely so everything works just like another platform. I'm going to test it soon on iOS/nintendo switch/PS4 actually, but I suspect compiling should be easy on those platforms.

You are right, it's big ( 300mb in debug, the .a is a big less then 30mb ) and probably slow ( we just use it for inference so that should be ok ) but still it fits the task for us.
The size in release might be smaller, dead code elimination and so on should help.
Still if you are bound to a `nodejs` only environment it's a better option at least for me.

Anyway it's just a start. :smile:
